name: CompressiveGhostImaging

screenshots.caption: Compressive ghost imaging demonstration. A laptop screen is used to illuminate the object. In this case, the object is a human hand. A single-pixel detector is used to detect the total intensity transmitted by the object.

short_description:
Here you can find control software that can be used to perform a simple compressive ghost imaging experiment. An example of such an experiment is demonstrated in the YouTube video linked on this page.

Usual imaging methods use cameras with millions of pixels and apply compression (e.g. jpeg compression) only after the picture has been taken. Here, we use only a single pixel detector to create (color) images and we gather only a small fraction of the information, effectively compressing the image while taking it.

This demonstration is our entry into the Dutch "1000 euro proefjes" competition.
summary: Software for "do it yourself" compressive ghost imaging
